headline.main: THE 43rd PRESIDENT: THE CELEBRATION; Many Inaugural Plans, but Few Details

lead_paragraph: Still far behind schedule because of the protracted vote-counting in Florida, aides to President-elect George W. Bush announced the inauguration's theme and just a few plans today, betraying how many had yet to be made 18 days before the swearing-in of the 43rd president. The theme will be ''Celebrating America's Spirit Together.'' Asked whether that represented an effort to unite the nation, Jeanne Johnson Phillips, the inaugural's executive director, said the divisive election had not been a factor in planning the ''inclusive, open, positive'' celebration.
abstract: Aides to Prest-elect George W Bush say theme of inauguration will be 'Celebrating America's Spirit Together; say there will be open house at White House after Bush is sworn in; eight receptions and balls are being planned; photo (M)
